channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- Logo Manager For Enamad
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- Logo Manager For Enamad

item.title: CVE-2024-5170|2024-09-17T06:00:02.039Z -- unknown -- logo%20manager%20for%20enamad
item.description: The Logo Manager For Enamad WordPress plugin through 0.7.1 does not sanitise and escape in its widgets settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2024-4757|2024-06-25T13:09:07.802Z -- unknown -- logo%20manager%20for%20enamad
item.description: The Logo Manager For Enamad WordPress plugin through 0.7.0 does not have CSRF check in some places, and is missing sanitisation as well as escaping, which could allow attackers to make logged in admin add Stored XSS payloads via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-4757|2024-06-25T06:00:02.291Z -- unknown -- logo%20manager%20for%20enamad
item.description: The Logo Manager For Enamad WordPress plugin through 0.7.0 does not have CSRF check in some places, and is missing sanitisation as well as escaping, which could allow attackers to make logged in admin add Stored XSS payloads via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-4757|2024-08-01T20:47:41.785Z -- unknown -- logo%20manager%20for%20enamad
item.description: The Logo Manager For Enamad WordPress plugin through 0.7.0 does not have CSRF check in some places, and is missing sanitisation as well as escaping, which could allow attackers to make logged in admin add Stored XSS payloads via a CSRF attack
